privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.data_text: At Portal Lusitano, we treat your personal data with the same rigor we treat the genetics of our breed. Your member data (Portal ID) is used exclusively to manage your account and purchase history.
privacy.collection_text: We collect information when you register on our site, make a purchase or subscribe to our newsletter. This includes your name, email and billing address.
privacy.cookies_text: We use cookies to improve your browsing experience and process items in your shopping bag through Shopify's secure infrastructure.

terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.scope_text: Portal Lusitano operates as a marketplace and editorial platform dedicated to the Lusitano breed. By accessing our site, the user agrees to comply with these terms of use.
terms.marketplace_text: Commercial transactions carried out through our store are processed securely. Portal Lusitano reserves the right to carefully select the pieces and stud farms present on the platform to guarantee the brand's quality standard.
terms.intellectual_text: All editorial content, design and photographs present in the Lusitano Journal and store are the exclusive property of Portal Lusitano or its duly identified partners.
terms.liability_text: Although we make every effort to ensure the accuracy of information about stud farms and genetic lineages, Portal Lusitano is not responsible for inaccuracies provided by third parties.

calculadora.title: Value Calculator
calculadora.intro_quote: A tool developed for breeders, buyers and equestrian professionals seeking a well-founded evaluation.
calculadora.intro_desc: Based on APSL evaluation criteria, BLUP indices, European market analysis and international dressage standards.
calculadora.feat_genetic_desc: Evaluation based on the main Portuguese lineages: Veiga, Andrade, Alter Real and National Stud.
calculadora.feat_blup_desc: Approximate genetic index calculation based on morphology, gaits and reproductive history.
calculadora.feat_market_desc: Value adjustments for different markets: Portugal, Central Europe, UK and Americas.
calculadora.methodology_desc: This calculator considers over 20 parameters including conformation according to APSL standards, gait quality (elevation, suspension, regularity), training level according to FEI scales, temperament, competition history, veterinary documentation and market dynamics. Values are indicative and should be complemented by in-person evaluation.
calculadora.market_influence: The market influences the value: markets like the USA and Germany have greater purchasing power.
calculadora.disclaimer_text: This evaluation is an estimate based on the data provided and does not replace an in-person assessment by a qualified professional. The actual value may vary significantly depending on market conditions, negotiation, geographical location and individual horse characteristics. We always recommend a complete veterinary inspection and specialist evaluation before any transaction.
calculadora.regional_market_subtitle: Estimated value of this horse in different markets
calculadora.investment_subtitle: Estimated value evolution based on age curve
calculadora.investment_disclaimer: Projection assumes current health and training conditions are maintained
calculadora.training_roi_subtitle: Estimated impact of each training level on value
calculadora.pro_projections_disclaimer: Estimated values based on market averages. This does not constitute financial advice.
calculadora.waterfall_subtitle: Contribution of each category to the final value
calculadora.liquidity_subtitle: Estimated ease of sale in the current market
calculadora.safety_low_risk: Low-risk investment. Good prospects for appreciation and liquidity.
calculadora.safety_moderate_risk: Moderate risk. Consider factors such as age and market trends.
calculadora.safety_high_risk: High risk. Evaluate carefully before investing.
calculadora.tooltip_confidence: Indicates the reliability of the estimate. Values above 70% indicate complete and coherent data.
calculadora.tooltip_percentile: Relative position in the PSL market. The 80th percentile means the horse is worth more than 80% of comparable horses.
calculadora.tooltip_multiplier: Factor applied to the base value. Results from the combination of training, competitions, lineage and conformation.
calculadora.tooltip_blup: Best Linear Unbiased Prediction — genetic merit indicator. The BLUP shown here is a simplified estimate, NOT an official APSL BLUP.
calculadora.tooltip_percentile_card: Based on value ranges from the Portuguese equestrian market for PSL horses.
calculadora.source_blup: Simplified estimate — does not replace official APSL BLUP
calculadora.source_mercado: Ranges based on Portuguese equestrian sector averages
calculadora.source_conformacao: Conformation criteria according to the Lusitano breed standard
calculadora.source_treino: Training levels referenced to FEI scales
calculadora.confidence_range_explanation: Based on the completeness of provided data
calculadora.factor_conformacao_desc: Morphological assessment according to APSL standards
calculadora.factor_andamentos_desc: Elevation, suspension, regularity of the three basic gaits
calculadora.factor_treino_desc: Training level according to FEI scales
calculadora.factor_idade_desc: Ideal age range: 6-12 years for maximum value
calculadora.limitation_1: Does not consider the horse's current physical condition
calculadora.limitation_2: BLUP is a simplified estimate, not official APSL
calculadora.limitation_3: Market values based on Portuguese sector averages
calculadora.limitation_4: Does not replace an in-person assessment by a qualified professional

comparador.intro_quote: Compare up to 4 horses side by side with detailed analysis of conformation, gaits, training and market value.
comparador.intro_desc: Radar charts, comparative tables and cost-benefit analysis to help with decision making.
comparador.feat_radar_desc: Intuitive visualisation of each horse's characteristics across multiple quality dimensions.
comparador.feat_table_desc: Detailed parameter-by-parameter comparison with automatic highlighting of the best values.
comparador.feat_value_desc: Cost per quality point calculation to identify the best investment.
comparador.disclaimer_text: This comparison is a decision support tool based on the data provided. The score is calculated considering multiple quality factors according to APSL standards. The final decision should include in-person evaluation and veterinary examination.
comparador.verdict_desc: In-depth analysis of strengths, weaknesses and recommendation for each horse
comparador.cost_projection_desc: Total cost of ownership including purchase, maintenance and future value estimate
comparador.cost_disclaimer: Estimated costs based on Portuguese market averages. Actual values may vary significantly.
comparador.confidence_high: High confidence. The choice is clear and well-founded.
comparador.confidence_moderate: Moderate confidence. Consider analysing more parameters.
comparador.confidence_low: Low confidence. The horses are very similar or there are risks.
comparador.tooltip_radar: Each axis represents a dimension rated 0 to 10. The total area reflects the horse's overall profile.
comparador.tooltip_score: Composite score (0-100) weighting: Lineage (15%), Training (15%), Conformation (10%), Gaits (10%), Age (10%), Height (8%), Temperament (7%), Health (7%), BLUP (5%), Competitions (8%), APSL (3%), Elevation+Regularity (5%).
comparador.tooltip_valor_ponto: Price divided by total score. The lower, the better the cost-benefit ratio.
comparador.tooltip_melhor_score: The horse with the highest total score across all evaluated factors.
comparador.tooltip_melhor_valor: The horse with the lowest cost per score point.
comparador.limitation_2: The score does not capture rider-horse chemistry
comparador.limitation_3: Prices declared by the user, not verified

verificador.intro_quote: Analyse compatibility between stallion and mare before breeding. COI prediction, BLUP, coat colours and genetic risks.
verificador.intro_desc: Based on equine genetics principles, BLUP indices and Lusitano Stud Book (APSL) selection standards.
verificador.feat_coi_desc: Calculation of predicted Inbreeding Coefficient to help avoid genetic problems in offspring.
verificador.feat_coat_desc: Foal coat probabilities based on Extension, Agouti, Grey and Cream genotypes of both parents.
verificador.feat_risks_desc: Identification of common genetic defects such as WFFS, OCD and other hereditary problems to avoid.
verificador.about_desc: This tool analyses over 10 parameters including reproductive age, physical compatibility, genetic quality, conformation, gaits, temperament, health status, fertility and known genetic defects. The result includes BLUP, COI and foal coat predictions, as well as personalised recommendations.
verificador.coat_genetics_hint: If unknown, keep default values (Ee, Aa, Gg, NN, dd)
verificador.disclaimer_text: This analysis is a decision support tool and does not replace consultation with a veterinarian specialising in equine reproduction or a geneticist. Results are estimates based on the data provided. We always recommend carrying out complete genetic tests before any breeding.
verificador.breeding_calendar_desc: Reproductive cycle timeline based on the ideal breeding season
verificador.offspring_radar_desc: Predicted offspring aptitudes based on weighted parent averages
verificador.foal_value_desc: Estimated foal value at three development stages
verificador.foal_value_disclaimer: Estimated values based on market averages and genetic quality. This does not constitute financial advice.
verificador.tooltip_score: Genetic compatibility score (0-100) based on COI, BLUP, conformation, gaits and history of both parents.
verificador.tooltip_coi: Coefficient of Inbreeding — measures genetic relatedness. Below 3% is excellent; above 6.25% increases the risk of hereditary problems.
verificador.tooltip_blup: Estimate of the foal's genetic merit, based on parental average. Simplified BLUP — not official.
verificador.tooltip_altura: Estimate based on parental average ±2cm. Environmental factors may cause significant variations.
verificador.tooltip_pelagem: Probabilities based on simplified Mendelian genetics. Actual results depend on untested alleles.
verificador.source_coi: Calculated from declared pedigree — for official COI consult APSL
verificador.source_blup: Simplified estimate — official BLUP requires full APSL database
verificador.source_pelagem: Basic Mendelian genetics — does not replace genetic testing
verificador.method_coi: Inbreeding coefficient estimated from declared pedigree
verificador.method_blup: Weighted average of parental genetic merit
verificador.method_conformacao: Morphological complementarity of the pair per APSL standards
verificador.method_repro: Fertility history, births and neonatal survival
verificador.method_apsl: Bonus for both parents with official APSL registration
verificador.method_linhagem: Diversity and quality of both parents' pedigree
verificador.limitation_1: Does not consider specific genetic diseases
verificador.limitation_2: COI based on declared pedigree, not DNA analysis
verificador.limitation_3: Estimated BLUP — not an official APSL value
verificador.limitation_4: Does not replace specialised reproductive veterinary consultation

analise_perfil.intro_desc: An analysis developed by specialists to identify the Pure Blood Lusitano horse profile that best suits your objectives.
analise_perfil.checklist_desc: Interactive list organised in 3 phases to guide your purchase
analise_perfil.budget_desc: Monthly and annual maintenance cost estimate
analise_perfil.budget_disclaimer: Estimated values for the selected profile. Actual costs vary by region and service level.
analise_perfil.confidence_desc: This value indicates the consistency of your answers. The higher it is, the more aligned your choices were with the identified profile.
analise_perfil.ready_desc: Explore our stud farm directory or use our analysis tools.
analise_perfil.instagram_copied: Text copied! Paste in Instagram Stories or post.
analise_perfil.tooltip_confidence: Indicates how complete and consistent your answers are. High values indicate a well-defined profile.
analise_perfil.tooltip_distribution: Shows relative affinity with each archetype. Most riders combine elements from several profiles.
analise_perfil.tooltip_costs: Based on Portuguese market averages for your profile. Actual values vary by region and service level.
analise_perfil.method_experience: Equestrian experience level declared by the user
analise_perfil.method_objectives: Primary declared objectives for horse riding
analise_perfil.method_budget: Declared financial capacity for investment and maintenance
analise_perfil.method_availability: Weekly time available to dedicate to the horse
analise_perfil.method_infrastructure: Housing conditions and access to facilities
analise_perfil.method_preferences: Personal preferences for breed, coat and discipline
analise_perfil.limitation_1: Profile based solely on quiz answers
analise_perfil.limitation_2: Costs are national averages and may vary by region
analise_perfil.limitation_3: Does not consider specific personal circumstances
analise_perfil.disclaimer_text: This analysis is a guidance tool based on your quiz answers. Results are indicative and do not replace advice from equestrian sector professionals. Costs and recommendations may vary significantly depending on region, local market and individual circumstances.

linhagens.title: Lineage Guide
linhagens.subtitle: Discover the history and characteristics of the main Lusitano horse lineages. Centuries of selection and equestrian tradition.
linhagens.importance_p1: The Lusitano horse has distinct lineages developed over centuries by families dedicated to breeding. Each lineage has unique characteristics in terms of conformation, temperament and aptitudes.
linhagens.importance_p2_prefix: In 1989, the Portuguese Equine Genealogical Book officially recognised
linhagens.importance_p2_suffix: as the genetic pillars of the entire breed: 5 stallions (Agareno, Primoroso, Destinado, Marialva II and Regedor) and 1 mare (Hucharia).
linhagens.other_lineages_text: There are other recognised lineages in Lusitano breeding, such as Coimbra and Infante da Camara. However, the information available online about these lineages is very limited, existing mainly in specialised equestrian literature and APSL records. For rigour, we chose not to publish data we cannot verify from credible sources.
linhagens.timeline_subtitle: From 1748 to 1989 — the moments that defined the Lusitano breed
linhagens.choose_title: How to Choose the Ideal Lineage?
linhagens.choose_step1_desc: Dressage, bullfighting, working equitation or leisure? Each lineage has specific aptitudes. Veiga excels in bullfighting and WE, Alter Real in Haute Ecole, Andrade in dressage.
linhagens.choose_step2_desc: Veiga horses are more reactive and courageous, ideal for experienced riders. Andrade and National Stud are calmer and more versatile, suitable for all levels.
linhagens.choose_step3_desc: Meet horses of different lineages in person. Each specimen is unique and direct interaction is irreplaceable.
linhagens.no_notable_horses: Limited information about notable horses of this lineage.

vender_cavalo.apsl_notice: All horses must be registered in the APSL Blue Book (Portuguese Association of Purebred Lusitano Horse Breeders).

vender_cavalo.placeholder_stud_origin: Name of the stud farm where the horse was born
vender_cavalo.blue_book_desc: Copy of the horse's official registration
vender_cavalo.placeholder_health_notes: Relevant information about the horse's health
vender_cavalo.photos_tip: Include photos from different angles: profile, front, rear, hooves, and in motion if possible.
vender_cavalo.placeholder_description: Describe the horse in detail: temperament, qualities, reason for sale, special characteristics...
vender_cavalo.highlight_desc: Appear at the top of the list and on the homepage for 7 days. 3x more views!
vender_cavalo.terms_agree: I have read and accept the
vender_cavalo.terms_confirm: I confirm that all information provided is true and that I am the legal owner of the horse.
